title: label_frames() GUI: "Error - bodyparts must have unique labels! Please choose unique bodyparts in config.yaml file and try again"

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
## Error with label_frames()
**System Specs**
Windows 10 10.0.16299 SP0, with an Anaconda Env, using DeepLabCut 2.0.8

**Problem**
With no notable changes to the system, in the past few days the label_frames() GUI crashes when I try to select data to label for new DLC models. When I run the function on an old config file it still works. However, I am able to create a new project, add videos and extract frames. The GUI loads at first, but as soon as I select a folder to label, the GUI crashes and a ValueError is thrown. This problem crashes Python sometimes as well. I have seen past errors with regards to wxPython and the solutions posed have not fixed my problem. It should also be noted that the DLC error regarding unique labels is not reflected in the cfg['bodyparts']. Finally, please note that we are storing and accessing the config files from a network server. I have tried storing both the project and videos locally, but to no avail, nor when I open a new command prompt.

**How to Reproduce the problem**
1. Create a new project
2. Extract frames
3. deeplabcut.label_frames()
4. Select a folder

**Screenshots**
![error1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25079885/66273702-210c1f80-e86e-11e9-8d3a-b6e5484d9e32.PNG)
![error2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25079885/66273704-22d5e300-e86e-11e9-87bb-84c5a6c9380d.PNG)

**Additional context**
I have had a similar issue in the past that was apparently related to wx, but it seemed resolved overnight.
